      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Task add​(java.lang.Integer id, java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime, java.lang.String location, java.lang.String description)
      Preconditions:

      Postconditions:
      If id is null, an integer id is generated which is guaranteed to be unique for this instance of ToDoList if and only if no set-integer tasks have been added - that is, either manage ids externally or allow the ToDoList to manage them, do not mix the two
      The task added will be available to matching remove and find method calls until it is removed using ToDoList.remove(matching id) or the list is cleared using ToDoList.clear()
      void clear​()
      Preconditions:

      Postconditions:
      All tasks in the ToDoList will be removed and no longer available to matching remove and find methods

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public Task add​(java.lang.Integer id,
                java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime,
                java.lang.String location,
                java.lang.String description)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: ToDoList
        Preconditions:

        Postconditions:
        If id is null, an integer id is generated which is guaranteed to be unique for this instance of ToDoList if and only if no set-integer tasks have been added - that is, either manage ids externally or allow the ToDoList to manage them, do not mix the two
        The task added will be available to matching remove and find method calls until it is removed using ToDoList.remove(matching id) or the list is cleared using ToDoList.clear()
        Specified by:
        add in interface ToDoList
        Parameters:
        id - The intended id for this task (may be null, may not already be present in the ToDoList)
        dateTime - may not be null
        location - may not be null, empty, or longer than 256 characters
        description - Task description (may be null)
        Returns:
        • A reference to the created (not completed) Task matching the given parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any other preconditions are violated
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If a null id is passed after a non-null id task has already been added

      • remove

        public boolean remove​(int id)
        Description copied from interface: ToDoList
        Preconditions:

        Postconditions:
        Any task matching the given id will no longer be available to remove and find methods
        Specified by:
        remove in interface ToDoList
        Parameters:
        id - The target task id
        Returns:
        True if a task with a matching id was present in the list – otherwise false

        Preconditions:

        Postconditions:

        Specified by:
        findAll in interface ToDoList
        Returns:
        A list of all tasks contained by this ToDoList (may be empty) Changes to this list itself will not be reflected in the ToDoList, but changes to the Tasks it contains will be

      • findAll

        public java.util.List<Task> findAll​(boolean completed)
        Description copied from interface: ToDoList
        Preconditions:

        Postconditions:

        Specified by:
        findAll in interface ToDoList
        Parameters:
        completed - The target task completion status
        Returns:
        A list of all tasks contained by this ToDoList which match the completion status given by the parameter

      • findAll

        public java.util.List<Task> findAll​(java.time.LocalDateTime from,
                                    java.time.LocalDateTime to,
                                    java.lang.Boolean completed)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: ToDoList
        Preconditions:
        The to parameter must be later in time than the from parameter
        Postconditions:

        Specified by:
        findAll in interface ToDoList
        Parameters:
        from - The starting boundary (may be null)
        to - The finishing boundary (may be null)
        completed - The target completion status (may be null)
        Returns:
        If completed is null, a list of all tasks contained by this ToDoList whose datetime occurs after from and before to (both exclusive). If either is null their boundary is removed (e.g. if to is null then the method will return a list of all tasks whose datetime occurs after from). If both are removed this yields the same list as ToDoList.findAll(). If completed is not null, the yielded list additionally filtered to those tasks matching the given completion status.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the preconditions are violated

      • findAll

        public java.util.List<Task> findAll​(java.util.Map<Task.Field,java.lang.String> params,
                                    java.time.LocalDateTime from,
                                    java.time.LocalDateTime to,
                                    java.lang.Boolean completed,
                                    boolean andSearch)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: ToDoList
        Preconditions:
        The to parameter must be later in time than the from parameter
        Postconditions:

        Specified by:
        findAll in interface ToDoList
        Parameters:
        params - A map of Task.Fields and values to filter on within those Fields - may be null, but may not contain null values
        from - The starting boundary (may be null)
        to - The finishing boundary (may be null)
        completed - The target completion status (may be null)
        andSearch - Sets the filter status to match all if true, match any if false
        Returns:
        A list of all tasks which match the given filter status based on the following rules:
        • from and to filter on dateTime as exclusive boundaries - if either is null their side of the boundary is opened, if both are null does not filter on dateTime
        • completed filters on matching completion status if not null
        • params filters to the matching Task.Field and mapped value (contained string, not equality)
        • If andSearch is true this requires ALL above filters to match for all returned Tasks. If andSearch is false any task matching any given filter will be included
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the preconditions are violated

      • clear

        public void clear​()
        Description copied from interface: ToDoList
        Preconditions:

        Postconditions:
        All tasks in the ToDoList will be removed and no longer available to matching remove and find methods
        Specified by:
        clear in interface ToDoList
